ygData.subject: Re: Rarity of lambent stones
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well last night myself, another 35th lvl bard(Ziann), Mysten (35th lvl cleric), and a friendly 50th lvl shamen(Sharden) were killing everything in sight in
ygData.messageBody:
>From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
>Speaking of which, does anyone know what mobs are linked with griffennes?
>I'd like nothing
>better than to speed up their spawn rates by clearing some trash but don't
>know exactly who or
>what to kill. Beetles? Griffawns? Griffennes are annoyingly rare in such
>a large zone.
>
>Jyzan
>

Well last night myself, another 35th lvl bard(Ziann), Mysten (35th lvl
cleric), and a friendly 50th lvl shamen(Sharden) were killing everything in
sight in North Karana. It seemed that clearing the Griffawns did help the
poping of Griffennes and Griffons. It is amazing what 2 35th lvl bards with
tracking can do in a wide open zone. Ziann had the biggest train of the
night (5 griffawns), but I found the most Hill Giants (5). We netted 2
lambent stones, 3 Griffenne charms, and a Downey Feather for the Sharden. It
was a blast. Going to get arms and a bracers (is Genni is around) tonight
Woo hoo!

Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Craftsmen of Societus Argenti
